004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonAutoDetect;
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonCreator;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnoreProperties;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
011import java.util.Objects;
012
013/**
014 * Represents a translation in 2d space. This object can be used to represent a point or a vector.
015 *
016 * <p>This assumes that you are using conventional mathematical axes. When the robot is placed on
017 * the origin, facing toward the X direction, moving forward increases the X, whereas moving to the
018 * left increases the Y.
019 */
020@SuppressWarnings({"ParameterName", "MemberName"})
021@JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)
022@JsonAutoDetect(getterVisibility = JsonAutoDetect.Visibility.NONE)
023public class Translation2d {
024  private final double m_x;
025  private final double m_y;
026
027  /** Constructs a Translation2d with X and Y components equal to zero. */
028  public Translation2d() {
029    this(0.0, 0.0);
030  }
031
032  /**
033   * Constructs a Translation2d with the X and Y components equal to the provided values.
034   *
035   * @param x The x component of the translation.
036   * @param y The y component of the translation.
037   */
038  @JsonCreator
039  public Translation2d(
040      @JsonProperty(required = true, value = "x") double x,
041      @JsonProperty(required = true, value = "y") double y) {
042    m_x = x;
043    m_y = y;
044  }
045
046  /**
047   * Constructs a Translation2d with the provided distance and angle. This is essentially converting
048   * from polar coordinates to Cartesian coordinates.
049   *
050   * @param distance The distance from the origin to the end of the translation.
051   * @param angle The angle between the x-axis and the translation vector.
052   */
053  public Translation2d(double distance, Rotation2d angle) {
054    m_x = distance * angle.getCos();
055    m_y = distance * angle.getSin();
056  }
057
058  /**
059   * Calculates the distance between two translations in 2d space.
060   *
061   * <p>This function uses the pythagorean theorem to calculate the distance. distance = sqrt((x2 -
062   * x1)^2 + (y2 - y1)^2)
063   *
064   * @param other The translation to compute the distance to.
065   * @return The distance between the two translations.
066   */
067  public double getDistance(Translation2d other) {
068    return Math.hypot(other.m_x - m_x, other.m_y - m_y);
069  }
070
071  /**
072   * Returns the X component of the translation.
073   *
074   * @return The x component of the translation.
075   */
076  @JsonProperty
077  public double getX() {
078    return m_x;
079  }
080
081  /**
082   * Returns the Y component of the translation.
083   *
084   * @return The y component of the translation.
085   */
086  @JsonProperty
087  public double getY() {
088    return m_y;
089  }
090
091  /**
092   * Returns the norm, or distance from the origin to the translation.
093   *
094   * @return The norm of the translation.
095   */
096  public double getNorm() {
097    return Math.hypot(m_x, m_y);
098  }
099
100  /**
101   * Applies a rotation to the translation in 2d space.
102   *
103   * <p>This multiplies the translation vector by a counterclockwise rotation matrix of the given
104   * angle. [x_new] [other.cos, -other.sin][x] [y_new] = [other.sin, other.cos][y]
105   *
106   * <p>For example, rotating a Translation2d of {2, 0} by 90 degrees will return a Translation2d of
107   * {0, 2}.
108   *
109   * @param other The rotation to rotate the translation by.
110   * @return The new rotated translation.
111   */
112  public Translation2d rotateBy(Rotation2d other) {
113    return new Translation2d(
114        m_x * other.getCos() - m_y * other.getSin(), m_x * other.getSin() + m_y * other.getCos());
115  }
116
117  /**
118   * Adds two translations in 2d space and returns the sum. This is similar to vector addition.
119   *
120   * <p>For example, Translation2d{1.0, 2.5} + Translation2d{2.0, 5.5} = Translation2d{3.0, 8.0}
121   *
122   * @param other The translation to add.
123   * @return The sum of the translations.
124   */
125  public Translation2d plus(Translation2d other) {
126    return new Translation2d(m_x + other.m_x, m_y + other.m_y);
127  }
128
129  /**
130   * Subtracts the other translation from the other translation and returns the difference.
131   *
132   * <p>For example, Translation2d{5.0, 4.0} - Translation2d{1.0, 2.0} = Translation2d{4.0, 2.0}
133   *
134   * @param other The translation to subtract.
135   * @return The difference between the two translations.
136   */
137  public Translation2d minus(Translation2d other) {
138    return new Translation2d(m_x - other.m_x, m_y - other.m_y);
139  }
140
141  /**
142   * Returns the inverse of the current translation. This is equivalent to rotating by 180 degrees,
143   * flipping the point over both axes, or simply negating both components of the translation.
144   *
145   * @return The inverse of the current translation.
146   */
147  public Translation2d unaryMinus() {
148    return new Translation2d(-m_x, -m_y);
149  }
150
151  /**
152   * Multiplies the translation by a scalar and returns the new translation.
153   *
154   * <p>For example, Translation2d{2.0, 2.5} * 2 = Translation2d{4.0, 5.0}
155   *
156   * @param scalar The scalar to multiply by.
157   * @return The scaled translation.
158   */
159  public Translation2d times(double scalar) {
160    return new Translation2d(m_x * scalar, m_y * scalar);
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Divides the translation by a scalar and returns the new translation.
165   *
166   * <p>For example, Translation2d{2.0, 2.5} / 2 = Translation2d{1.0, 1.25}
167   *
168   * @param scalar The scalar to multiply by.
169   * @return The reference to the new mutated object.
170   */
171  public Translation2d div(double scalar) {
172    return new Translation2d(m_x / scalar, m_y / scalar);
173  }
174
175  @Override
176  public String toString() {
177    return String.format("Translation2d(X: %.2f, Y: %.2f)", m_x, m_y);
178  }
179
180  /**
181   * Checks equality between this Translation2d and another object.
182   *
183   * @param obj The other object.
184   * @return Whether the two objects are equal or not.
185   */
186  @Override
187  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
188    if (obj instanceof Translation2d) {
189      return Math.abs(((Translation2d) obj).m_x - m_x) < 1E-9
190          && Math.abs(((Translation2d) obj).m_y - m_y) < 1E-9;
191    }
192    return false;
193  }
194
195  @Override
196  public int hashCode() {
197    return Objects.hash(m_x, m_y);
198  }
199}
